articles.title: Kim Jong Il Participates in Election of Deputies to Local People's Assemblies
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Participates in Election of Deputies to Local People's Assemblies
 Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, Sunday went to the polling station of Sub-constituency No.150 of Constituency No. 264 for the election of deputies to the Pyongyang City People's Assembly and participated in the election of deputies to provincial, city and county people's assemblies.
					 He was accompanied by Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the WPK, and Kim Kyong Ok, member of the CMC of the WPK and first vice department director of the C.C., the WPK.
					
					 He was greeted on the spot by Yang Hyong Sop, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly who is chairman of the Central Election Guidance Committee, and Mun Kyong Dok, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the WPK and chief secretary of the Pyongyang City Committee of the WPK.
					
					 He received voting cards from the chairman of the election committee of the above-said sub-constituency and voted for Pak Hyong Ryol, manager of the Pyongyang Cornstarch Factory, who is candidate for a deputy to the Pyongyang City People's Assembly, and Kang Chol Ho, manager of the Ryongsong Quail Factory, who is candidate for a deputy to the Ryongsong District People's Assembly.
					
					 He met with the candidates and encouraged them to fulfill their missions and duties as representatives and servants of the people in the sacred struggle for the prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Election of Deputies to Local People's Assemblies Starts
articles.content:
Election of Deputies to Local People's Assemblies Starts
 Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- The election of deputies to provincial (municipal), city (district) and county people's assemblies of the DPRK has started simultaneously in all parts of the country at 09:00 Sunday.

articles.title: Election of Deputies to Local People's Assemblies Goes on
articles.content:
Election of Deputies to Local People's Assemblies Goes on
 Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- The election of deputies to provincial (municipal), city (district), county people's assemblies is now underway in the DPRK.
					 According to data available from the Central Election Guidance Committee, 84.66 percent of electors registered in the lists of electors took part in balloting as of 12:00 Sunday.
					
					 The election goes on.

articles.title: 97.58 Percent of Voters Participate in Local Election as of 14:00
articles.content:
97.58 Percent of Voters Participate in Local Election as of 14:00 
 Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- The election of deputies to provincial (municipal), city (district) and county people's assemblies of the DPRK is being successfully concluded.
					 According to data available from the Central Election Guidance Committee, 97.58 percent of the voters registered in the lists of electors took part in the balloting as of 14:00.
					
					 The election goes on.

articles.title: 99.97 Percent of Voters Participated in Local Election
articles.content:
99.97 Percent of Voters Participated in Local Election 
 Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- The election of deputies to the provincial (municipal), city (district) and county people's assemblies of the DPRK was successfully held on Sunday. 
					 According to data available from the Central Election Guidance Committee, 99.97 percent of voters except those on foreign tour or working in oceans participated in the election as of 18:00.
					
					 Those who were not able to go to the polling stations due to old age, illness, etc. cast their ballots into mobile ballot boxes.
					
					 All voters took part in the election with the revolutionary will to demonstrate the high spirit of Juche Korea making a leaping advance toward a thriving socialist nation and consolidate people's power under the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il through the election.

articles.title: Senior Officials Take Part in Local Election
articles.content:
Senior Officials Take Part in Local Election 
 Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- Senior party, state and army officials of the DPRK joined electors in taking part in the election of deputies to provincial (municipal), city (district) and county people's assemblies at polling stations in various places of the country on Sunday.
					 They voted for candidates for deputies to local people's assemblies.
					
					 The senior officials of the Party and state met voters and encouraged them devoting themselves to the prosperity of the socialist country, the greatest patriotic heritage of President Kim Il Sung, under the leadership of the Party as befitting the descendants of the President and expressed belief that they would discharge their revolutionary duty in the struggle for building a thriving nation and realizing the independent reunification of the country and the cause of global independence.

articles.title: DPRK Immersed in Festive Mood
articles.content:
DPRK Immersed in Festive Mood
 Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- The DPRK has an election for deputies to the provincial (municipal), city (district) and county people's assemblies on Sunday.
					 Streets are garbed in festive attire and decorated with national flags, red banners, placards and posters calling for consolidating the people's power.  
					
					 Polls are crowded by people in their best clothes.
					
					 They are waiting for the election to begin, some of them finding out their names in voters' lists and others dancing to the tune of drums and gongs.
					
					 Art troupes at all levels are joining them in livening up the atmosphere of election.
					
					 Reflected in their faces is a firm determination to, through the election, demonstrate the might of the Korean people closely rallied around the Workers' Party of Korea and the advantages of Korean socialism and glorify the hundred-year history of Kim Il Sung's Korea.  
					
					 The election begins at 9 a.m.

articles.title: Candidate for Election Vows to Faithfully Serve for People
articles.content:
Candidate for Election Vows to Faithfully Serve for People
 Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- An election for local people's assemblies is now going on throughout the DPRK.
					 Sub-constituency No. 93 of Constituency No. 57 in Pyongyang is crowded with voters ranging from old men and women to young people taking part in election for the first time.
					
					 Kim Yong, chairman of the election committee, told KCNA that the election is of weighty significance as it is being held when all the Korean people have turned out in the effort for glorifying the hundred-year history of Kim Il Sung's Korea.
					
					 Kang Sang O, an 80-year-old man residing in Saemaul-dong No.1, Phyongchon District, said, "We are really grateful to the government for setting up the people as masters of the country and guaranteeing happiness of all generations to come. So, we are casting ballots for the candidates we elected". 
					
					 Hong Su Ran, a 17-year-old student of Pyongyang University of Surgery, who takes part in voting for the first time, said:
					
					 "I am very happy to participate in election for people's assemblies. I will devote all my effort to upholding the people's power out of civil duties".
					
					 Kim Song Un, a candidate for deputy to the Pyongyang City People's Assembly, said, "I will contribute to the country's economic development and faithfully serve for the people, true to the leadership of Kim Jong Il for the building of a thriving nation".

articles.title: Papers Call upon All People to Participate in Local Election
articles.content:
Papers Call upon All People to Participate in Local Election
 Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- Papers Sunday editorially observe the day of election of deputies to local people's assemblies. 
					 Rodong Sinmun says those candidates for the deputies including workers, farmers and intellectuals have fully discharged their missions as fighters devotedly protecting the headquarters of the revolution, staunch champions and implementers of the party policies and genuine servants of the people over the past years. 
					
					 The election marks an occasion in fully demonstrating the invincible might of the Korean revolutionary ranks single-mindedly united around the leader and the iron will of the Korean people to reliably defend Korean-style socialism and share their destiny with socialism to the last. 
					
					 The Korean people have always voted for those candidates for the deputies intensely faithful to the party and the leader in each election, thereby fully displaying their steadfast will to follow only the party and the leader.
					
					 Every ballot to be cast by electors for the candidates represents a sledge-hammer blow at the imperialist reactionaries and other enemies keen to destroy the ideology and system of the DPRK and disturb the life of its people. The current election will provide the imperialist reactionaries and the south Korean authorities with an opportunity to know clearly that the strong will of the Korean people to defend socialism at the cost of their lives is by no means an empty talk. 
					
					 Minju Joson calls on all voters to actively participate in the election to fully discharge their mission and duty as dignified citizens of the DPRK and consolidate the revolutionary power as firm as a rock.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun said Situation Prevailing Requires Negotiated Solution of Fundamental Issue
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun said Situation Prevailing Requires Negotiated Solution of Fundamental Issue
 Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- The DPRK government will in the future, too, boost the friendly and cooperative relations with the regional countries in the idea of its foreign policy-- independence, peace and friendship-- and make every possible effort to defend the peace and security in the Korean Peninsula and the region.
					 Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun, head of the DPRK delegation, said this, when addressing the 18th Ministerial Meeting of the ASEAN Regional Forum on July 23.
					
					 He estimated the ASEAN Regional Forum for having made a positive contribution to the regional peace, security and prosperity on the principles of respect for sovereignty, non-interference in internal affairs and equality and ASEAN for playing a leading role in the activities of the Forum suited to the multifaceted structure of the regional security and cooperation and its growing scope.
					
					 The issue of the Korean Peninsula is one of the major concerns of the ASEAN Regional Forum, he said.
					
					 The national division forced by foreign forces and the ceasefire have lasted in Korea for more than half a century and the dangerous situation on the brink of war is prevailing there periodically, he said, and went on:
					
					  What is most urgently required by the DPRK and its people is a stable and peaceful environment as they are focusing all efforts on economic construction.
					
					  The prevailing situation is not only gravely threatening the sovereignty and security of the DPRK but hamstringing its people's efforts for peaceful development in every way.
					
					 But for the Songun politics pursued by leader Kim Jong Il and the powerful war deterrent of the DPRK, the peninsula would have turned into battle fields several times and the regional peace would have been totally wrecked.
					
					  It is the consistent stand of the DPRK government to guarantee the peace and stability in the peninsula and push forward its denuclearization through dialogue and negotiations.
					
					 The present situation in the peninsula now standing on the crossroads of detente and the vicious cycle of escalating tension requires the parties concerned to make the best use of opportunity of dialogue and make a bold decision to settle the fundamental issue.
					
					 Underlying the nuclear issue on the Korean Peninsula, the situation used to reach an explosive point periodically and the ever-escalating tension are the hostile relations between the DPRK and the U.S. which breed distrust and confrontation.
					
					 Mutual distrust can never be removed and the process of denuclearization can hardly make smooth progress as long as there remain the hostile relations in which the DPRK and the U.S., the signatories to the armistice agreement, are standing in confrontation with arms. This is the lesson taught by the course of the six-party talks which repeated setbacks and failures.
					
					  The proposal for concluding a peace agreement already advanced by the DPRK last year is the most effective step for confidence building as it helps wipe out the distrust between the DPRK and the U.S. and, furthermore, a powerful engine providing a guarantee for realizing the denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula. 
					
					 We are convinced that to strive to conclude a peace agreement is a right orientation both in view of the special security situation on the peninsula and in the light of the defense of the regional peace and security.
					
					 The denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula stipulated in the September 19, 2005 joint statement is a process of turning the whole peninsula into a nuclear-free zone on the basis of totally defusing the substantial nuclear threat to the peninsula from outside in a verifiable manner.
					
					 The U.S. is the main party responsible and capable of removing the root cause of the nuclear issue on the peninsula as it was spawned by the U.S. hostile policy and nuclear war threat to the DPRK from A to Z.
					
					 It is self-evident that to discuss the denuclearization issue in the absence of the main party concerned while distorting the essence of the issue would only lay an artificial hurdle in the way of  settling the issue and this cannot be a genuine dialogue.
					
					 The U.S. and the south Korean authorities are, however, reacting to the sincere proposals of the DPRK on building confidence through dialogue and negotiations and its efforts to resume the six-party talks with confrontation moves and military provocations. Yet, they are spreading misinformation that the DPRK is to blame for the tensions and the failure to open dialogue.
					
					 Now that the international community is unanimous in expressing deep concern over the tense situation on the peninsula, the joint military exercises being staged by them in south Korea with huge nuclear attack means involved cannot but be provocations and blatant provocations in view of their purpose and nature of coping with someone's "contingency."
					
					 After the present south Korean authorities came to power, the implementation of the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration warmly hailed and supported by all the fellow countrymen and the international community was totally suspended, the inter-Korean relations were extremely deteriorated and an atmosphere of a war against fellow countrymen is running higher. All their hostile acts against the DPRK have recently gone beyond such tolerance limit that they went the lengths of perpetrating the hideous provocations: They hurt the dignity of the leadership of the DPRK and its inviolable system. All facts go to clearly prove who truly wants dialogue and peace and who incites confrontation and war atmosphere on the peninsula.

articles.title: Minju Joson Urges U.S., S. Korean Warmongers to Stop Projected Nuclear War Exercises
articles.content:
Minju Joson Urges U.S., S. Korean Warmongers to Stop Projected Nuclear War Exercises
 Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, the south Korean warmongers announced they would stage "Ulji Freedom Guardian" joint military exercises in collusion with the U.S. from August 16 to 26.
					 Minju Joson Sunday says in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					 This is the most dangerous provocation as they are aimed at pushing the tense situation on the Korean Peninsula to the brink of war.
					
					 The said exercises are a nuclear attack rehearsal for invasion of the DPRK, not for "defense".
					
					 It is the ulterior intention of the U.S. imperialists and the puppet warmongers to ignite a war with huge forces and war hardware involved, if an opportunity presents itself.
					
					 They claim the planned saber-rattling is to cope with "all threats", in a bid to mislead the public at home and abroad. But it is no more than sheer sophism to cover up their black-hearted intention.
					
					 The exercises are a premeditated provocation of the warmongers seeking to stifle the DPRK by force of arms.
					
					 The U.S. remains unchanged in its hostile policy toward the DPRK to stifle it by force of arms. The Lee Myung Bak group, too, has not changed even a bit its ulterior intention to do harm to fellow countrymen with backing of outside forces.
					
					 Nothing is more foolish than the attempt of the group of traitors to realize its ambition for invading the DPRK by military means in collusion with the U.S. imperialists. 
					
					 The war hawks would be well advised to stop running riot and cancel at once the plan for the nuclear war exercises.

articles.title: Minju Joson Dismisses "Jongmi Seven-point Treaty" as Illegal
articles.content:
Minju Joson Dismisses "Jongmi Seven-point Treaty" as Illegal
 Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- "The Jongmi Seven-point Treaty" was a fraudulent document lacking any binding power as it was fabricated by those who had no certificates investing them with full power, quite contrary to the norms of international and domestic laws amid the armed threat and blackmailing of the Japanese imperialists. 
					 Minju Joson Sunday says this in a bylined article.
					
					 The Japanese imperialists cooked up the treaty on July 24, 1907 by brigandish means without getting the consent of Sunjong, the "new Emperor" after dethroning Kojong, the man responsible for the conclusion of the treaty, the article says, adding:
					
					 The signatories to the treaty did not have the above-said certificates and the treaty failed to get the signature of Kojong, the supreme sovereign of Korea at that time. And they robbed the Korean Emperor of the seal of the state and the foreign minister of his seal to put them on the text of the "treaty". These facts go to clearly prove that the "treaty" was an illegal and fraudulent document fabricated in wanton violation of international law on the signing and ratification of treaties.
					
					  The Japanese reactionaries are running the whole gamut of petty tricks to justify their history of aggression, talking about the "legitimacy" of Japan's past aggression on Korea, the article notes, and goes on: 
					
					 They are working hard to realize their military reinvasion of Korea again, zealously taking advantage of the U.S. strategy of dominating Asia.
					
					 They would be well advised to stop their rash acts and sincerely redress all the crimes Japan committed against the Korean people.

articles.title: DPRK Proves Successful in Military World Games
articles.content:
DPRK Proves Successful in Military World Games
 Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- The DPRK is proving successful at the 5th Military World Games in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.
					 Women shooters of the Korean People's Army placed first in the team 25m rapid-fire pistol event by scoring 1,725 points on July 22. 
					
					 Meanwhile, the DPRK bagged the silver medal in the women's team event of military pentathlon. 
					
					 Sung Song Guk caught a bronze medal in the 49kg category of men's boxing and Kim Su Gyong in the 63kg category of women's Judo.

articles.title: Worthwhile Life under Care of Great Leader (21)
articles.content:
Worthwhile Life under Care of Great Leader (21)
 Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- There is a legend to be conveyed forever in Taehongdan, a glorious land.
					 This legend is about Min Hong Dan named by general secretary　Kim Jong Il.
					
					 It was in March 2000 when the leader visited the family of Min Won Sik, a discharged soldier, during his field guidance to Taehongdan County.
					
					 He looked after every aspect of Min's life as his real father would do for his son who moved to a new house. When the wife of this ordinary discharged soldier unreservedly asked the leader to give a name to their baby to be born, he was so kind-hearted as to tell the couple to name the baby Tae Hong if it would be a son or Hong Dan if it would be a daughter.
					
					 Thanks to great blessings given by the leader, Min Hong Dan became a pride not only of the Min Won Sik's family and the 1 000 discharged soldiers who volunteered to work at the Paektusamcholli Plain but the whole county from the day of her birth.
					
					 The subsequent period witnessed the birth of many babies called Tae Hong and Hong Dan, who would shoulder upon themselves the future of Taehongdan County. Min Hong Dan graduated from a primary school and became the first-year student of Sodu Secondary School in the county on April 1 this year to have ample opportunity of learning.

articles.title: Work Carried by Nepali Paper
articles.content:
Work Carried by Nepali Paper
 Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- The first and second parts of general secretary　Kim Jong Il's work "Let Us Carry Out the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung's Instructions for National Reunification" were carried by the Nepali paper Charcha on July 18.
					 It carried portraits of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The work, published on August 4, Juche 86 (1997), clarifies the undying feats the President performed for national reunification and formulates the three principles of national reunification, the ten-point programme of the great unity of the whole nation and the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo advanced by him as the three charters for national reunification.
					
					 It also indicates the tasks and ways to accomplish the cause of national reunification on their basis.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Hit for Trying to Divide Progressive Forces
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Hit for Trying to Divide Progressive Forces
 Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- Voice of People, an Internet radio of south Korea, on July 20 condemned the authorities for their repressive moves to divide the progressive forces.
					 There broke out recently many cases in which the "National Security Law" was invoked against progressive organizations, the radio said.
					
					 Different circles are asserting that this is aimed to create a repressive atmosphere to prevent the ruling crisis in the last period of their office and divide the progressive forces, it noted.
					
					 Most of the recent cases are ruled as those lacking in evidence, it said. This proves that the ruling forces are driven into such tight corner.
					
					 The radio accused the authorities of conducting an unreasonable investigation into progressive organizations by linking them with the DPRK and working hard to deter the progressive forces from coming to power in the run-up to the next year's elections.

articles.title: China Issues Notice on Army Day
articles.content:
China Issues Notice on Army Day
 Beijing, July 23 (KCNA) -- The Ministry of Civil Affairs of China and the General Political Department of the Chinese People's Liberation Army jointly issued a notice on the 84th anniversary of the CPLA.
					 The notice called for fostering social atmosphere in which the army loves the people and the latter protects the former.
					
					 All regions and domains should help overall construction including combat preparations of the stationary military units whereas all units should take an active part in the economic and social construction in the areas they are stationed, it said.

articles.title: Natural Disasters in Cuba, Chile
articles.content:
Natural Disasters in Cuba, Chile
 Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- Cuba registered a record high of 695 forest fires as over 20 000 hectares were blackened by forest fires from January to May.
					 It is taking positive steps to prevent forest fires.
					
					 Heavy snows fell in southern Chile recently, causing damage.
					
					 The worst heavy snow fall in the last ten years displaced about 6,500 inhabitants as of July 20, blocking roads and suspending electricity supply.
					
					 Eight areas were declared stricken ones and an emergency rescuing work is being done.

articles.title: Brazil to Increase Defense Capability
articles.content:
Brazil to Increase Defense Capability
 Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- Brazil has started building four diesel-powered submarines to increase the defense capability.
					 The first vessel is expected to be ready for delivery by 2016.
					
					 Building of submarines in Brazil is a strategic issue and a guarantee of sovereignty, said Brazilian President Dilma Rousseff Monday.

articles.title: Bolivia to Combat Drug Trafficking
articles.content:
Bolivia to Combat Drug Trafficking
 Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- Bolivia's police recently detected and destroyed 281 cocaine factories through anti-drug operation, according to the country's Interior Minister on Monday.

articles.title: Hamas Official Condemns Israel for Interception of Aid Vessel
articles.content:
Hamas Official Condemns Israel for Interception of Aid Vessel
 Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- A high-ranking official of Palestine's Hamas in a press conference on July 19 strongly condemned the Israeli authorities.
					 The Israeli naval forces intercepted a foreign ship sailing to the Gaza Strip with humanitarian aids that day. He labeled this an act of piracy.
					
					 He called upon the international community to attack the Israeli authorities seeking the jungle law.

articles.title: Earthquake Hits Taiwan
articles.content:
Earthquake Hits Taiwan
 Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- An earthquake measuring 5.2 on the Richter scale jolted the sea off Taiwan's eastern coast Wednesday.
					 The epicenter was located at some 64.8 km east to Hualien County.

articles.title: U.S. Drone Attack Kills 4 in Pakistan
articles.content:
U.S. Drone Attack Kills 4 in Pakistan
 Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- The U.S. forces in Afghanistan are continuing air raids on Pakistan under the pretext of "anti-terrorism".
					 At least four people were killed Wednesday when a U.S. drone fired missiles in the northwestern Pakistani tribal area of North Waziristan.

articles.title: Japanese Local Authorities Protest against U.S. Sub-critical Nuclear Test
articles.content:
Japanese Local Authorities Protest against U.S. Sub-critical Nuclear Test
 Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- The mayor of Nagasaki of Japan in a press conference on July 20 protested the U.S. sub-critical nuclear test.
					 It has been proved that the U.S. conducted a sub-critical nuclear test again. He said the current test would lead to the development of the technology for a new nuclear weapon.
					
					 Meanwhile, the Nagasaki City Government and the governor of Nagasaki Prefecture respectively sent written protests to the U.S. embassy in Tokyo on the same day.

articles.title: Japan's Export Down
articles.content:
Japan's Export Down
 Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- Japanese exports fell 1.6 percent in June from a year earlier, the Finance Ministry of Japan said in a preliminary report on July 21.

articles.title: Russia to Strengthen Anti-Crime Campaign
articles.content:
Russia to Strengthen Anti-Crime Campaign
 Moscow, July 23 (KCNA) -- Russia is paying big sustained efforts to anti-crime campaign.
					 The Investigation Department of the Russia Ministry of Interior recently quoted survey data as saying that officials of the judicial organs detected about 124,000 cases of economic crimes this year.

articles.title: Egyptian FM Condemns Israeli Illegal Act
articles.content:
Egyptian FM Condemns Israeli Illegal Act
						
 Cairo, July 23 (KCNA) -- The Egyptian foreign minister on July 20 condemned Israeli illegal act.
					 Israeli naval forces' action against a ship bound for the Gaza Strip with humanitarian aids on July 19 is a wanton violation of the international law, he said. The case showed again before the world the need to put an immediate end to Israeli blockade to the Gaza Strip.
					
					 Egypt will continue to help end the Strip sufferings by sending its humanitarian aids, he added.

articles.title: Indonesia Protests U.S. over Aircraft's Violation of Its Territory Border
articles.content:
Indonesia Protests U.S. over Aircraft's Violation of Its Territory Border
 Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- The Indonesian military Wednesday sent a protest letter against the United States after a U.S. transport aircraft entered Indonesia's territory without permission at the end of June.
					 The government and army of Indonesia will never allow such acts of threatening the security of the country, the letter said.

articles.title: Swelter Persists in U.S.
articles.content:
Swelter Persists in U.S. 
 Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- Harsh sweltering weather is persisting in the United States, causing damage.
					 140 million inhabitants are suffering from swelter in the central western area and eastern area as of July 20 and an emergency alarming was issued in more than 30 states in these areas.
					
					 Over 37 degrees centigrade registered in many states in the central western area and 35 degrees centigrade in the eastern area.
					
					  Worse still, humidity is high and so effective temperature can exceed 40 degrees centigrade, the U.S. meteorological authorities said.

articles.title: DPRK Praised by World Public
articles.content:
DPRK Praised by World Public 
 Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- World public praised the DPRK as a people-centered socialist country.
					 The Egyptian paper Al-Ray noted that the DPRK is a people-centered unique socialist state where the people have become the masters of everything and everything serves them with the Juche idea founded by President Kim Il Sung as its guiding principle.
					
					 The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy posted on its Internet homepage an article stressing that the 60 odd-year history of the DPRK is a shining history of creation and construction in which Korean-style socialist state was built by exploring the untrodden path and a history of warm love whereby the people have been provided genuine freedom and happiness. 
					
					 The Pakistani paper Baluchistan Times said the DPRK is a genuine state which firmly protects and guarantees the independent rights of the popular masses.
					
					 The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea said in its internet homepage that the DPRK is envied by world people as a country where the people's welfare is systematically promoted, a tax-free country, a country where free education and free medical care are in force and a country that has greeted a heyday of art. 
					
					 The Brazilian Committee for Solidarity with the DPRK noted in its internet homepage that it is common practice in the DPRK that teachers visit their students and doctors visit their sick people, adding this clearly shows the real picture of the people-centered Korean style socialism.
					
					 The chairman of the Korean Friendship Association said the people of the DPRK are leading an equal and happy life, provided with all living conditions by the state thanks to the popular policies of the Workers' Party and government of Korea.
					
					 The chief of the Norwegian Branch of the Korean Friendship Association said that all the people of the DPRK are firmly united around general secretary Kim Jong Il and the whole society has turned into a big harmonious family thanks to his politics of trust and benevolence.

articles.title: Feats Praised by Bangladeshi Personage
articles.content:
Feats Praised by Bangladeshi Personage
 Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- Garib Newaz, president of the Bangladesh People's League and chairman of the Bangladesh Self－Reliance Research Centre, on July 19 issued a statement to mark the 14th anniversary of general secretary Kim Jong Il's work "Let Us Carry Out the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung's Instructions for National Reunification".
					 The statement said:
					
					 Kim Il Sung set forth the most fair and aboveboard and reasonable proposals for national reunification on the basis of his deep insight into the situation of the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 He explored the cause of national reunification and led it to victory with his distinguished idea and leadership.
					
					 Kim Jong Il formulated the three principles of national reunification, the ten-point programme of the great unity of the whole nation and the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo, advanced by the President, as the three charters for national reunification.
					
					 The north-south joint declaration, adopted and published on June 15, 2000, is a cornerstone for the development of the inter-Korean relations and a great programme for Korea's reunification as it indicates the basic principles for achieving national reconciliation, unity and reunification and the ways to do so.
					
					 It is my firm belief that the Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean people would certainly achieve the cause of national reunification under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Day of DPRK's Victory in War Marked Abroad
articles.content:
Day of DPRK's Victory in War Marked Abroad
 Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- Political parties and organizations of different countries have marked the 58th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 The Organization of the North Caucasus Region of the All-Union Communist Party of Bolsheviks of Russia on July 14 posted on its Internet homepage an article on the undying feats of President Kim Il Sung, an outstanding strategist, who led the Korean people to victory in the war with his original war methods, tactics and strategies.
					
					 The victory of the Korean people in the war to beat back the armed invasion by the U.S. imperialists would have been unthinkable without the President's extraordinary military strategies, the article said.
					
					 The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea on July 18 posted on its Internet homepage an article dealing with the losses the U.S. suffered in the last Korean War and the atrocities committed by its forces.
					
					 In the war the U.S., which recorded only "victories without any defeat" in more than 110 wars it fought, suffered a shameful defeat for the first time in the U.S. history, the article said.
					
					 The homepage cited data to disclose that during the war the U.S. imperialists killed many innocent people, destroyed all kinds of buildings, devastated farm land and massively used biochemical weapons in wanton violation of international law.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il participa en las elecciones de diputados
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il participa en las elecciones de diputados
 Pyongyang, 24 de julio (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, visito el dia 24 el lugar del subdistrito no. 150 del distrito electoral no. 264 para las elecciones de diputados a la Asamblea Popular de la ciudad de Pyongyang, para participar en las elecciones de diputados a las Asambleas Populares de las provincias, las ciudades  y los distritos de la RPDC.
					 Le acompanaron Kim Jong Un, vicepresidente de la Comision Militar Central del PTC y Kim Kyong Ok, miembro de la CMC del PTC y primer subjefe de departamento del CC del PTC.
					
					  Acogieron en el mismo terreno al Dirigente Yang Hyong Sop, miembro del Buro Politico del CC del PTC, vicepresidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema y presidente del Comite Central de Direccion Electoral y Mun Kyong Dok, miembro suplente del BP y secretario del CC del PTC y secretario responsable del Comite del PTC en la Ciudad de Pyongyang.
					
					  El Dirigente recibio las cedulas electorales de parte del presidente del comite electoral del citado subdistrito y voto a los candidatos de diputados a las Asambleas Populares de la ciudad de Pyongyang y del municipio de Ryongsong: Pak Hyong Ryol, gerente de la Fabrica de Elaboracion de Cereales de Pyongyang y Kang Chol Ho, director de la Fabrica de Codorniz de Ryongsong.
					
					  El Dirigente se reunio con dichos candidatos de diputados y los estimulo a cumplir sus misiones y deberes como representantes y servidores fieles al pueblo en la sagrada lucha por prosperidad de la patria.

articles.title: Corea en jolgorio por elecciones de diputados
articles.content:
Corea en jolgorio por elecciones de diputados
 Pyongyang, 24 de julio (ATCC) -- Tendran lugar hoy las elecciones de diputados a las Asambleas Populares de las provincias (las ciudades directamente subordinadas al centro), las ciudades (los municipios) y los distritos.
					 Los lugares de votacion fueron decorados en colores de fiesta en compania de las canciones mientras en las calles aledanas flameaban las banderas nacionales y las rojas y saltaban a la vista las consignas y pancartas llamando a consolidar el poder revolucionario.
					
					 Esperaban el comienzo de votacion los electores en vestidos elegantes que buscaban sus nombres en el padron electoral exhibido en las tablas colocadas al pie de las urnas.
					
					 Por otra parte, se escuchaban las vibraciones de tambor y gong que tocaban bailando muchos electores. 
					
					 El ambiente electoral llego a su climax cuando los artistas de entidades artisticas de distintos niveles comenzaron a ofrecer sus funciones.
					
					 En el rostro de cada elector se denotaba la determinacion de votar a favor para demostrar otra vez el poderio de la unidad monolitica entre todos los militares y civiles en torno al Partido del Trabajo de Corea y la superioridad del socialismo al estilo coreano y para dinamizar las labores orientadas a glorificar la historia centenaria de la Corea de Kim Il Sung.
					
					 La votacion comienza a las 9 por la manana.

articles.title: Determinaciones de votantes y candidatos de diputados
articles.content:
Determinaciones de votantes y candidatos de diputados 
 Pyongyang, 24 de julio (ATCC) -- En todas las localidades de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea tienen lugar el dia 24 las elecciones de los diputados a los organos del poder local.
					 En el subdistrito no. 93 del distrito electoral no. 57 de la ciudad de Pyongyang participan en la votacion todos los electores desde los ancianos hasta los ciudadanos mayores a los 17 anos quienes participan por primera vez en las elecciones, llenos de confianza absoluta en el poder revolucionario.
					
					 El presidente del comite electoral de dicho lugar, Kim Yong (54 anos de edad), subrayo:
					
					 Las presentes elecciones tienen suma importancia porque se efectuan en los tiempos emocionantes en que el ejercito y el pueblo de Corea libran la ofensiva general para acoger la historia centenaria de la Corea de Kim Il Sung como sus fidedignos descendientes.
					
					 El morador del barrio no. 1 de Saemaul del capitalino municipio de Phyongchon, Kang Sang O (80 anos de edad), dijo:
					
					 Experimentamos a traves de la vida real la gratitud al Poder de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea que presenta al pueblo como digno dueno del pais y garantiza la felicidad de las generaciones venideras. Es por eso que votamos a favor de los delegados elegidos.
					
					 La estudiante de la Universidad de Medicina Externa de Pyongyang, Hong Su Ran (17 anos de edad), quien participa por primera vez en las elecciones destaco:
					
					 Al pensar que soy tambien dueno del verdadero Poder revolucionario no puedo detener mi orgullo y alegria.
					
					 En el futuro dedicare toda mi fuerza y pasion a consolidar monoliticamente nuestro poder cumpliendo con mi deber de ciudadano de la republica.
					
					 El candidato de diputado a la asamblea popular de la ciudad, Kim Song Un (54 anos de edad), subrayo:
					
					 En pleno acato al noble proposito del Dirigente  Kim Jong Il quien dirige al frente la construccion de una gran potencia prospera, contribuire a la labor para activar la economia del pais y cumplire con mi responsabilidad y papel como servidor fiel al pueblo.

articles.title: 99,97 por ciento de electores participan en elecciones
articles.content:
99,97 por ciento de electores participan en elecciones 
 Pyongyang, 24 de julio (ATCC) - Tuvieron lugar con exito el dia 24 las elecciones de los diputados a las Asambleas Populares de las provincias (las ciudades directamente subordinadas al centro), las ciudades (los municipios) y los distritos de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea. 
					 Segun los datos recogidos por el Comite Central de Direccion Electoral, hasta a las 18:00, 99,97 por ciento de electores excepto los que estan en el extranjero o trabajan en alta mar, estuvieron presentes en la votacion.  
					
					 Los electores incapaces de acudir al lugar para la votacion por motivo de vejez, enfermedad, etc. votaron en las urnas moviles.
					
					 Todos los votantes participaron como un solo hombre en las elecciones con el entusiasmo revolucionario de mostrar el invencible espiritu de Corea del Juche que avanza hacia la gran potencia prospera socialista y fortalecer con mas firmeza el poder popular en pleno acato a la guia del Songun del Dirigente Kim Jong Il a traves de las presentes elecciones.
